biography: Mikael, a name synonymous with dedication at Kurk Golf, has graced the fairways of the Hector Trophée on one occasion. Though the coveted Hector Trophée and the Victor Trophy have eluded him, Mikael's presence has always been marked by a quiet intensity and respect for the traditions of the game.

Known amongst his peers for his meticulous preparation and thoughtful approach to course management, Mikael embodies the spirit of sportsmanship. While his competitive fire burns brightly, he always finds time to share a word of encouragement with fellow competitors.

While Mikael is considered retired from future Hector Trophée events, his influence on the younger generation of golfers at Kurk Golf remains significant. It is always possible that there are last-minute changes to the field, and that Mikael could surprise us all with a late entry to the Hector Trophée 2025.
